page.title: 01Review of Block 04120117
page.content: This area of land lies to the west of the River Avon,some eight miles south of Salisbury and a few miles north of the small town of Fordingbridge. It is a sparsely populated rural area,containing two small villages, {Breamore<pop.324>}and{Whitsbury {<pop.241>.} Well-drained chalk uplands,noted for sheep and dairy farming, form the northwestern corner of the block.The land slopes down to the Avon in the southeast,where the soft river clays have formed marshland near Breamore. Most of this area is arable farming land, with wheat and barley being the chief crops.Grazing still predominates on the uplands and near the river in the east. There are a few areas of woodland in the centre of this block, mainly mixed deciduous but with one conifer plantation.
